intro: Sesuvium eastwoodianum, commonly known as Eastwood's sesuvium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Sesuvium eastwoodianum is adapted to arid environments and is capable of surviving in harsh, saline conditions.
